notes_text: Possession prohibited, but use is common and largely tolerated. Possession of up to 10 g decriminalized.
notes: Possession prohibited, but use is common and largely tolerated. Possession of up to 10 g decriminalized.
notes_raw: {{main|Cannabis in Belize}} Possession prohibited, but use is common and largely tolerated.<ref>{{cite web|last=Hubbard|first=Kirsten|title=Drug Laws and Penalties in Central America|url=http://gocentralamerica.about.com/od/culturehistory/p/Central-America-Drug-Laws-And-Penalties.htm|publisher=About.com|access-date=2 January 2014|archive-date=14 May 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170514082404/http://gocentralamerica.about.com/od/culturehistory/p/Central-America-Drug-Laws-And-Penalties.htm|url-status=dead}}</ref> Possession of up to {{cvt|10|g|frac=8}} decriminalized.<ref>{{cite news |title=The Future of Marijuana under Debate |url=https://edition.channel5belize.com/archives/157025 |access-date=7 January 2024 |work=News 5 |date=5 December 2017}}</ref>
